result.execSummary:
The defendant Hernandis Cortez Burks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hernandis Cortez Burks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hernandis Cortez Burks was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:34 AM Defendant Hernandis Cortez Burks in court with attorney Margaret Marlene Vinz.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements. Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 2. Court found guilty. Judgment was entered. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in jail, with Huber work release, consecutive to any other. $443.00 costs. Submit DNA sample. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Bond on hand will be applied towards costs. Stipulation to be filed for total jail credit. Jail start2/1/19 at 7 pm. 5 days jail credit until stipulation is filed. 12:00 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2019 at 11:30 am.
